titles.title: To revise, codify, and enact without substantive change certain general and permanent laws, related to patriotic and national observances, ceremonies, and organizations, as title 36, United States Code, "Patriotic and National Observances, Ceremonies, and Organizations".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 105-326.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 110.

action.text: Mr. Pease moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Hatch without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 477.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/3/1998--Passed House amended. Enacts title 36 of the United States Code into positive law to be entitled "Patriotic and National Observances, Ceremonies, and Organizations." Makes technical, conforming, and consolidating changes to existing law.
